author: Staff Reporter
text:
Of the total 579 children went missing in the past 10 years in the district, the police had rescued 563 children.

Superintendent of Police G. Subbulakshmi said that 211 boys and 368 girls went missing from their homes in the district. In 2015, of the 27 boys who went missing, 26 were rescued, while of the 119 girls who went missing, 108 girls were rescued and handed over to their parents.

She said that a special drive, ‘Operation Smile 2’, was launched to rescue the missing 16 children. A team comprising members from District Anti-Human Trafficking Wing, District Social Welfare Department, District Labour Welfare Officer had been visiting children homes, railway stations, bus stands, home for mentally ill and residential schools to find them. It would be carried out till January 31.

- Staff Reporter
title: 560 missing children rescued in 10 years: SP
